title: Bot Lane Main and The Current Meta
body:
As a player who plays both the ADC or support 95% of the time, am I one of —if not the only—person that LIKES this meta?  

Honestly, the ADC role is not dead or useless from what I've seen; the snowball potential is still more than possible.  Personally, I love the threat of being the biggest target for assassins because then I'm forced to actually learn to adapt and prepare for each potential one shot.  Honestly, isn't learning to adapt the entire POINT of winning games?  If you die, that's your fault FIRST (yes, I have accounted for trolls and ragers).  

As a support, it's your job to make sure your team can do their job...and it starts in lane with your ADC partner.  I can't do it alone, sure; but, again: it's about adapting to each game.  You can't win every game, but, you sure as hell can make things go smoother each time.

There are hundreds upon hundreds of guides and tips on what you can do.  Mechanically, I'm definitely low elo with how clumsy I am in game, but, I keep wanting to learn.  You are in control of yourself and nobody else.

I've heard life begins at the end of your comfort zone...but I also believe life ends the day you stop wanting to learn.

(Off topic, but, any grammar nazis that happen to read this, please tell me what mistakes I've made in this post! I really wanted to get everything right. >_<; )

I actually hate those champions.  Jinx and Leona are my main 2 for the lane. :P

I mean it's so bad that when I win lane as Jinx without jungler help I don't even feel good from it cause I just feel like the opponent was just garbage! Cause I know if they were any good they would of shat on me with that lethality adc.

I really think theres something im missing. the meta is jhin vs 'insert champ that can fight him' and it has been for quite some time now.

But everyone seems ok with this. Regardless of how balanced or how much counterplay there is to the champion does no one see a problem with bot lane being nothing but jhin vs varus right now?
